tips.text: Scarpetta, Scott Contant's seasonally-inspired Italian restaurant, serves delicious dishes like Creamy Polenta, Duck & Foie Gras Ravioli and his signature Spaghetti.
Chef Scott Conant recommends the “spectacular” lobster-basil tramezzini, as told to us in his New York Diet.
Chef/owner Jonathan Waxman runs this neighborhood place and makes food that makes people happy. -Jimmy Bradley , Top Chef
Prosciutto stars in an array of starter plates at this bustling Bib. - Inspector
Rustic Italian eatery from the makers of 'ino. A good romantic spot set in a magically warm room, decked out in dark woods, slate-blue walls and lit by candles.

user.firstName: How To Make It In America

tips.text: A restaurant and pasta shop--this is where you should buy your pasta in Chelsea.
The menu includes house-cured meats & Italian cheeses, fish courses like charred octopus & cured sardines, fresh pastas with everything from pork ragout to braised duck.
The meatballs are the largest most amazing balls you'll ever eat. Been here 12 times and everything else is delicious too!
Consider the house-made pastas ($17-$18) or the popular charred octopus with chorizo dish ($16).
20 wine bottles for $20 each
I just got carded! LOL
For a dependable, flexible red wine, opt for the Campania IGT "Campole" '08 by Fattoria Alois. Based on the aglianico grape variety, this full-bodied "Barolo of the South" is a good value.
Head here when you want a quick bite (the artichoke and proscuitto pie) and some vino.
Top Chef-winner Harold Dieterle's restaurant for Italian and German cuisine from his family heritages. Don't leave without ordering the bone marrow with sea urchin.

items.message: Let your server or bartender know that you’ve unlocked the special on a “Classic Negroni” cocktail, featuring BOMBAY SAPPHIRE® Gin, and join us in celebrating the Tribeca Film Festival!
items.title: Special

tips.text: Totally desorganized!

For special occasions or big groups, reserve a private room which includes making dessert in an open kitchen. As for dinner, black ink seafood pasta and pollo fra diavlo... Holy food coma. Incredible.
Amazing Italian grocery store
One of best italian in nyc.  Hidden gem
Gorge on lip-smackingly low-cost pasta entrees for <$10 here. Order Spaghetti alla Carbonara ($8.50) or Pappardelle alla Bolognese ($9.95).
Do you like clams? What about clams on pizza? Yes? Then get the Vongole pizza. It's one of the best white clam pies I've had in NYC—similar to, and up there with, Motorino's, Franny's.
Interesting selection of pizza and music posters scattered throughout. I recommend trying a plain slice of pizza as well as "The Newman" and "Mr. Pink". - Brett Petersel
Order the spinach gnocchi with fresh tomato sauce.
There is a 40-bottle list of Italian wines, all available for $40. The sommelier also curates a reserved wine list for something a little more special. Via CityEats.com
NY. This delicious restaurant delivers every time. You will never leave here disappointed. Make sure to order a couple crudos for the table and get the pappardelle rabbit cacciatore to share.
This West Village gem run by Florence-born Rita Sodi features a seasonal menu that always has a few excellent pastas. If you're lucky, one option will be the lasagna with carciofi (artichokes).
